required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Fats on Satiety and Energy Needs
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Fats on Satiety and Energy Needs

lead_sponsor.agency: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.source: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: The influences of specific dietary fat sources on satiety, appetite and energy utilization remains unclear; evidence is lacking on whether responses vary according to acute intake. The researchers will use a controlled setting to determine whether the source of dietary fat is related to perceived satiety, satiety hormone responses, and energy expenditure by conducting experiments to evaluate short term (acute) effects.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Acute effect of fat intake on energy expenditure as determined by metabolic rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Incremental Area Under the Curve (iAUC) of metabolic rate from 0 to 4 hours

arm_group.description: 30 grams saturated fat in the form of heavy whipping cream will be provided to subject in a smoothie drink
30 grams monounsaturated fat in the form of high oleic canola oil will be provided to subject in a smoothie drink
30 grams polyunsaturated fat in the form of high linoleic sunflower oil will be provided to subject in a smoothie drink
30 grams polyunsaturated fat in the form of flaxseed oil will be provided to subject in a smoothie drink
30 grams polyunsaturated fat in the form of fish oil (Coromega Omega3 Squeeze) will be provided to subject in a smoothie drink

intervention.description: High saturated fatty acid/SFA oil source
High monounsaturated fatty acid/MUFA oil source
High polyunsaturated fatty acid (linoleic)/PUFA-LA oil source
High polyunsaturated fatty acid (alpha-linolenic)/ALA oil source
High polyunsaturated fatty acid (omega-3)/LCn3 oil source

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- body mass index between 25.0-34.9 kg/m2
- free of major diagnosed, untreated medical conditions
- controlled hypertension
- non-smoking or use of other tobacco products, including e-cigarettes
- not taking steroid-based medications
- not planning to or currently attempting to gain or lose weight
- willing to comply with study demands
- use of oral contraceptives
- low intake of long chain omega 3 fatty acids
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed eating disorders
- diabetes (blood sugar ≥ 126 mg/dl)
- hypertension (systolic ≥ 160 mmHg or diastolic > 100 mmHg)
- diagnosed cardiovascular, pulmonary, skeletal and metabolic disease
- currently pregnant or planning to become pregnant, or lactating
- taking medications known to affect appetite, blood lipids, body composition, body weight, or food intake (appetite control drugs, steroids, antidepressants)

overall_official.affiliation: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

facility.name: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center
